snippet: For President Obama, the collateral damage the National Security Agency surveillance has inflicted on his relationship with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is, perhaps, a more painful cost of the episode.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; one casualty of National Security Agency's surveillance of German Chancellor Angela Merkel has been the warm rapport between her and Pres Obama; Merkel, one of Obama's few close friends among leaders of Group of 8 countries, has said that there has been a breach of trust that will have to be repaired.
lead_paragraph: For President Obama, the collateral damage the National Security Agency surveillance has inflicted on his relationship with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is, perhaps, a more painful cost of the episode.

headline.main: One Casualty of Eavesdropping on Merkel: A Warm Rapport
headline.print_headline: One Casualty of Eavesdropping on Merkel: A Warm Rapport
